sentence: This is basically a good shirt
Most of my shirts are Van Huesen, and I appreciate them
However, ithis was advertised and described as a FLEX  collar, and the collar did not stretch nor flex
It had labels on it declaring that it was a Flex collar
I have some Van Huesen shirts with flex flex collars, that have a built-in extendable collaf
They are good
This one did not stretch
Otherwise a good shirt
I think the supervisor of the guy over in Bangladesh
country of origin
told him to put 275 of the "FLEX COLLAR" tags on by lunch time, and the worker, perhaps not being literate, worked hard to get them all affixed
This shirt replaced a similar Joseph Fees brand dress shirt
I did have to iron it before the first wear, but since then it's been wash, dry, &amp
wear with no worries
I wore this shirt to a job interview, and next thing I know I've moved 2000 miles and I'm making more money than I ever have
Idk if that's the shirt's fault, but it certainly didn't hurt anything
This is the very first product review that I have ever written and I am 77 years old
I bought two shirts, one white and one blue and they were delivered separately
The white one was in original packaging and was perfect
apparently by another supplier
The blue shirt is the issue
It was delivered in a loose package and it looked like someone had been sleeping in it for a week
It was completely wrinkled and out of its original packaging
My wife wanted me to return it or take it to the cleaners for pressing but I'm not interested in paying someone to do something that should not be needed
My wife agreed to iron the shirt so I hope the wrinkles come out but this is ridiculous
The sleeves are supposed to be 36-37 inches
Not even close
Plus the left sleeve is about 2 inches shorter than the right sleeve
The right sleeve is about 34 inches and the left is too short to even button
Not a good shirt
I returned the other shirt and will keep this because I need a dress shirt for a wedding
But, it will be a one time wear and then junk it
I have always liked Van Heusen shirts,
As they fit well, look good too
I particularly like this color, but that_ a personal
preference
I highly recommend the quality though
Fits perfect, color and texture is great
Is cut nicely, too
For $22, I'd buy this shirt regularly
Some of the other colors were priced for a lot more but I won't spend any more for a shirt I wear to work when I can drive to the mall and spend $10 on the clearance rack for dress shirts
This is a decent shirt
but there are a few things of note about this shirt:
Pros:
The neck fit is nice with a little stretch
Wrinkle free is great
Cons:
The shirt came with a small black spot on it that doesn't seem to come out in the wash
By "regular fit" they mean huge
Like really HUGE
If you are not large person you should look for a "slim fit" or "skinny fit"
This is more of a "regal fit" in my opinion
The wrinkle free shirt definitely needs to be ironed, but I expected that
The flex neck is very comfortable
The shirt fits true to size
I could probably use more of a tapered fit
I_ not a slim fit
, but I ordered the regular classic fit which has plenty of room
I ordered 4 shirts
I will order more like this if I can find other colors in my size
Please note: the first two I ordered from Macy_ were a nightmare
When they arrived
the white one had two different size sleeves, as well as different style sleeves
I wrote a negative review on Macy_ site and returned it to Macy_ in person
The salesperson didn_ ask any questions and didn_ care when I told him the issue
I did not want them to resell the shirt
18 neck, 32-33 sleeves
So, I ordered 2 more through Amazon
These two arrived together but one was not in it_ original packaging, and was a mess
It was scrunched up in a ball and stuffed in a plastic bag
I planned on washing/ironing them first anyway and was thankful they fit and had matching
correct
style sleeves
The issue I think was Christmas time shopping over loud  and I believe Van Heusen is going out of business
The neck is to large, I measured against some other shirts I have and it is over an inch bigger
It is not a stretch neck as advertised
The sleeves are short, they are 2 to 3 inches shorter than my other shirts with the same sleeve length
I would send it back but I bought it for an event and I had to wear it, now it is going to Goodwill
Don't buy this shirt
Very comfortable with a nice fit
The colors are bright and bold, which are perfect for me as an elementary teacher
The only negative I've found is that Purple Haze is awfully close to Hearth, which I had ordered previously
I believe the camera flash has left it looking a bit brighter in the demo photo above than it actually appears in real life
I was somewhat disappointed when I put it in my closet and noticed that they were very close shades of one another, with Hearth just having a tinge more red than Purple Haze
Looks great
packaged well
But as it says the neck stretches or whatever, just know I used to wear a 17 1/2 and needed bigger so I got 18 and with the stretch feature I thought I'd be ok
But it still just barely fit
I can't imagine my neck went up 2 sizes so I wouldn't really take the stretch part to the bank
If you think you need a specific size get that or maybe 1/2 bigger
The shirt is the same cut as the shirts I_e bought from the brick and mirror store
However the _lassic pink is more lavender than pink
I included a picture of what it looks like compared to my husbands actual pink and purple shirts and as you can tell, it_ light purple
It_ fine, I_l keep the shirt, it_ just annoying since I was trying to replace a pink shirt
In a dress shirt, it's all about the collar
Fabric or prints are always overshadowed by either a sad, weak collar that won't standup or like this shirt, a stiff, vertical collar that stands up to a distinctive profile

Ordered longer arms because I am heavier in my upper back and the length is roomy by 1 inch but I expect shrinkage by 1/2 inch
Great fit

This is a nice white shirt for dress or professional wear
And it has a chest pocket, which is a feature that is rapidly disappearing in men_ shirts
It does not have a placket down the front of the shirt where the buttonholes are located, which to us makes this shirt look a little more casual
The fit is _s expected
My husband_ neck is between a 15 ½ and a 16, and he found the size 15 ½ a bit snug but wearable
The fit is neither slim, nor baggy
in other words, _egular is appropriate
The fabric is a bit lighter than the shirts my husband usually wears
He prefers a somewhat heavier fabric
I liked the weight of this one
Then comes the acid test: the laundering
Coincidentally I washed this shirt with a white oxford-cloth dress shirt, a fabric that is my usual gold standard for wrinkle-free performance
The Van Heusen was ALMOST as wrinkle-free as the oxford cloth
It would certainly be fine under a jacket and would do for regular office wear, but I think a touch-up ironing would be in order if the wearer wanted to make an especially good impression
Fit as expected in neck and sleeves
I will add this caution to gentlemen out there who want to buy dress shirts online without trying them on, make sure to measure your neck and arms
Especially if you have a shirt size in mind, but haven_ worn a dress shirt in a few years
Or go to a department store and try some on, then come back to Amazon and save some money
Back to the shirt
Very nice, high end look
No shirt is truly wrinkle free, but this fabric once ironed should stay pretty crisp if you make sure to hang it when you_e done
The one thing I wasn_ quite sure on was the _tretch advertised

I thought a stretch neck, or fabric with a little more give would be a great feature for a formal dress shirt, but I grabbed a handful of fabric and tugged, in both the neck and body of the shirt, there was no give at all
Just standard fabric
Doesn_ detract at all from the quality or attractiveness of the shirt, just confused me a little because of the stretch advertised in the labeling
Either way this is a very sharp shirt you can wear with a tie to dress it up, or a few buttons down without the tie, maybe even untucked if you wish
Still looks good either way
It_ nice and light, as well as breathable which is something we can all appreciate when the temperature rises, or when you find yourself at a stuffy event
Overall good fit, good packaging, hit it with an iron or steamer for a few minutes, toss on a tie and you_e ready to go
It will have you looking sharp in no time
I was surprised to see this shirt was made in in Ethiopia, first time I ever had anything made there

I didn_ find anything particularly stretchy in the collar, it did have some give, but don_ expect it to stretch like women_ leggings
I found the lighter patches along the tops of the shoulders a bit distracting, but the look is plainly evident in the listing pics  check out the pics of the models back
My 16
5 neck/34-35 sleeves were perfectly sized
It_ a regular fit, but for me it fit close to that of a fitted shirt, this one was not at all boxy
I wish they would stop using pins in the packaging, other than that the shirt did not disappoint
